snippet: The major developed countries are all experiencing slowdowns in growth, a trend the International Monetary Fund’s new projections indicate will continue.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column observes that major developed countries are all experiencing slowdowns in growth, a trend the International Monetary Fund’s new projections indicate will continue; graphs show gross domestic product for United States and other Group of 7 nations.
lead_paragraph: The major developed countries are all experiencing slowdowns in growth, a trend the International Monetary Fund’s new projections indicate will continue.

headline.print_headline: A Bleak Outlook for Long-Term Growth
headline.seo: A Long-Term Slide in Growth for Industrialized Economies
headline.main: A Bleak Outlook for Long-Term Growth
